intro: Strychnos likimiensis, commonly known as the Likimiensis spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its chemical composition, it has been studied for potential medicinal properties.
